concepts.concept_name: SI units and fundamental/derived quantities
Dimensional analysis and dimensional formulae
Significant figures and rounding off
Errors in measurement: systematic and random errors, propagation of errors
Accuracy, precision, and least count of measuring instruments

in_scope: SI base units and derived units
Dimensional formulae of physical quantities
Checking dimensional consistency of equations
Deriving relations using dimensional analysis
Rules for significant figures in arithmetic operations
Absolute, relative, and percentage errors
Combination of errors in addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and powers
Vernier callipers and screw gauge least count
out_of_scope: CGS or FPS systems in detail
Dimensional analysis for trigonometric or exponential functions
Advanced error analysis beyond Class 11 level

concepts.concept_name: Position, path length, displacement, and frame of reference
Average and instantaneous velocity and speed
Acceleration and equations of motion for uniformly accelerated motion
Graphical analysis: position-time and velocity-time graphs
Free fall and motion under gravity

in_scope: Distinction between distance and displacement
Uniform and non-uniform motion in one dimension
Three kinematic equations: v = u + at, s = ut + (1/2)at^2, v^2 = u^2 + 2as
Interpretation of x-t and v-t graphs
Area under v-t graph as displacement
Freely falling bodies with g = 9.8 m/s^2 or 10 m/s^2
out_of_scope: Air resistance effects on free fall

concepts.concept_name: Scalars and vectors: addition, subtraction, and resolution of vectors
Scalar (dot) and vector (cross) products
Projectile motion: trajectory, time of flight, range, and maximum height
Uniform circular motion: angular velocity, centripetal acceleration
Relative velocity in two dimensions

in_scope: Triangle and parallelogram law of vector addition
Unit vectors (i, j, k) and component form
Projectile motion equations assuming no air resistance
Range formula R = (u^2 sin2θ)/g
Centripetal acceleration a = v^2/r = ω^2r
Relative velocity for rain-man, river-boat type problems
out_of_scope: Coriolis force or rotating frame effects

concepts.concept_name: Newton's first law, inertia, and momentum
Newton's second law: F = ma and impulse-momentum theorem
Newton's third law and conservation of momentum
Friction: static, kinetic, and rolling friction; laws of friction
Circular motion dynamics: centripetal force, banking of roads, conical pendulum

in_scope: Free body diagrams for systems of bodies
Problems involving pulleys, inclined planes, and connected bodies
Impulse as area under F-t graph
Coefficient of friction and angle of friction
Banking of roads with and without friction
Motion of a car on level circular road
out_of_scope: Pseudo forces in non-inertial frames beyond basic concept
Fluid friction or drag force calculations

concepts.concept_name: Work done by constant and variable forces
Kinetic energy and work-energy theorem
Potential energy: gravitational and elastic (spring) potential energy
Conservation of mechanical energy and conservative/non-conservative forces
Power: instantaneous and average power
Collisions: elastic and inelastic collisions in one and two dimensions

in_scope: Work done as dot product W = F·d
Work done by gravity, friction, spring force
Spring PE = (1/2)kx^2
Energy conservation in pendulum, spring-mass, and free-fall problems
Power = Fv
Coefficient of restitution
Head-on elastic and perfectly inelastic collision formulae
out_of_scope: Oblique collisions with complex 2D vector analysis beyond NCERT
Potential energy curves and equilibrium analysis beyond basic concept

themes.theme_name: Motion of System of Particles and Rigid Body

topics.topic_name: System of Particles and Rotational Motion

concepts.concept_name: Centre of mass: definition, calculation for discrete and continuous bodies
Torque, angular momentum, and their relation
Moment of inertia and radius of gyration
Theorems of parallel and perpendicular axes
Rolling motion: combined translational and rotational motion

in_scope: Centre of mass of two-particle system and symmetric bodies
Torque τ = r × F
Angular momentum L = Iω and conservation of angular momentum
Moment of inertia of standard shapes: ring, disc, cylinder, sphere, rod
Application of parallel and perpendicular axis theorems
Kinetic energy of rolling body = (1/2)mv^2 + (1/2)Iω^2
Condition for pure rolling: v = Rω
out_of_scope: Centre of mass of irregular continuous bodies requiring integration
Moment of inertia tensor or principal axes

concepts.concept_name: Newton's universal law of gravitation and gravitational constant
Acceleration due to gravity and its variation with altitude, depth, and latitude
Gravitational potential energy and gravitational potential
Escape velocity and orbital velocity of satellites
Kepler's laws of planetary motion and geostationary satellites

in_scope: F = GMm/r^2 and superposition principle for gravitational forces
Variation of g: g' = g(1 - 2h/R) for altitude, g' = g(1 - d/R) for depth
Gravitational PE = -GMm/r
Escape velocity v_e = √(2gR)
Orbital velocity v_o = √(gR) for near-surface orbit
Kepler's three laws: orbits, areas, periods (T^2 ∝ r^3)
Energy of a satellite in orbit

concepts.concept_name: Stress, strain, and Hooke's law
Stress-strain curve and elastic behaviour of materials
Elastic moduli: Young's modulus, bulk modulus, and shear modulus
Poisson's ratio and elastic potential energy in a stretched wire

in_scope: Types of stress: tensile, compressive, and shearing
Types of strain: longitudinal, volumetric, and shearing
Hooke's law and proportionality limit
Stress-strain curve: elastic limit, yield point, fracture point
Y = stress/strain for a wire
Elastic PE per unit volume = (1/2) × stress × strain
out_of_scope: Plastic deformation theory beyond basic stress-strain curve
Thermal stress calculations beyond simple problems

concepts.concept_name: Pressure and Pascal's law; hydraulic machines
Buoyancy and Archimedes' principle
Streamline flow, equation of continuity, and Bernoulli's theorem
Viscosity, Stokes' law, and terminal velocity
Surface tension, surface energy, capillarity, and angle of contact

in_scope: Pressure at a depth: P = P_0 + ρgh
Pascal's law and hydraulic lift/brake
Archimedes' principle and floatation
Bernoulli's equation: P + (1/2)ρv^2 + ρgh = constant
Applications: venturimeter, atomiser, Magnus effect
Viscous force F = 6πηrv (Stokes' law)
Capillary rise h = 2S cosθ/(ρgr)
Excess pressure in drops and bubbles
out_of_scope: Turbulent flow and Reynolds number derivation
Surface tension at molecular interaction level

concepts.concept_name: Heat, temperature, and thermal equilibrium; temperature scales
Thermal expansion: linear, area, and volume expansion
Specific heat capacity, calorimetry, and change of state
Heat transfer: conduction, convection, and radiation
Newton's law of cooling and black body radiation (qualitative)

in_scope: Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin scale conversions
Coefficients of linear, area, and volume expansion; relation α, β, γ
Anomalous expansion of water
Q = mcΔT and principle of calorimetry
Latent heat of fusion and vaporisation
Thermal conductivity and rate of heat flow: Q/t = KA(T1-T2)/L
Stefan-Boltzmann law (qualitative), Wien's displacement law (statement)
Newton's law of cooling and its graphical representation
out_of_scope: Heat conduction in two or three dimensions
Advanced calorimetry with phase transitions at non-standard pressures

concepts.concept_name: Thermal equilibrium and zeroth law of thermodynamics
Internal energy, work, and first law of thermodynamics
Thermodynamic processes: isothermal, adiabatic, isobaric, isochoric, and cyclic
Second law of thermodynamics: Kelvin-Planck and Clausius statements
Heat engines, refrigerators, and Carnot engine; Carnot's theorem

in_scope: Sign convention for work and heat in thermodynamics
First law: ΔU = Q - W
Work done in isothermal process: W = nRT ln(V2/V1)
Work done in adiabatic process using PV^γ = constant
P-V diagrams for all processes
Efficiency of heat engine: η = 1 - Q2/Q1
Carnot efficiency: η = 1 - T2/T1
COP of refrigerator
out_of_scope: Entropy as a state function and its detailed calculation
Real engine cycles (Otto, Diesel) in detail

themes.theme_name: Behaviour of Perfect Gases and Kinetic Theory

concepts.concept_name: Ideal gas equation and gas laws (Boyle's, Charles's, Gay Lussac's, Avogadro's)
Kinetic theory assumptions and pressure of an ideal gas
Kinetic interpretation of temperature and RMS speed
Degrees of freedom, law of equipartition of energy, and specific heat capacities of gases
Mean free path

in_scope: PV = nRT and PV = NkT
Derivation of pressure P = (1/3)ρ<v^2>
KE per molecule = (3/2)kT
RMS, average, and most probable speeds
Degrees of freedom for mono-, di-, and polyatomic gases
Cp - Cv = R and γ = Cp/Cv for different gases
Mean free path formula l = 1/(√2 π n d^2)
out_of_scope: Van der Waals equation and real gas behaviour
Quantum effects on degrees of freedom
Transport phenomena: diffusion, thermal conductivity, viscosity from kinetic theory

concepts.concept_name: Periodic and oscillatory motion; simple harmonic motion (SHM) and its equation
Displacement, velocity, and acceleration in SHM; phase
Energy in SHM: kinetic and potential energy; energy conservation
Simple pendulum and spring-mass system: time period derivations
Damped oscillations, forced oscillations, and resonance

in_scope: x = A sin(ωt + φ) or x = A cos(ωt + φ)
v = Aω cos(ωt + φ), a = -ω^2 x
T = 2π/ω, f = 1/T
T of simple pendulum = 2π√(l/g)
T of spring-mass = 2π√(m/k)
Springs in series and parallel
Qualitative description of damping and resonance
out_of_scope: Detailed mathematical treatment of damped/forced oscillation differential equations

concepts.concept_name: Transverse and longitudinal waves; wave equation and wave speed
Speed of sound in different media; factors affecting speed of sound
Principle of superposition and interference of waves
Standing waves: nodes, antinodes; vibrations in strings and organ pipes
Beats and Doppler effect in sound

in_scope: y = A sin(kx - ωt) and related wave parameters
v = fλ, k = 2π/λ, ω = 2πf
Speed of transverse wave on string: v = √(T/μ)
Speed of sound: Newton's formula and Laplace correction
Constructive and destructive interference conditions
Harmonics and overtones in strings (fixed at both ends, one end)
Open and closed organ pipes: frequency relations
Beat frequency = |f1 - f2|
Doppler effect formula for sound (source and observer moving)
out_of_scope: Intensity and loudness calculations beyond basic level
